text: Pierre Jules Théophile Gautier (August 30, 1811 – October 23, 1872) was a French poet, dramatist, novelist, journalist, and literary critic. He was a member of the Club des Hashischins, or Hashish Club. This group of French writers experimented with hashish to get ideas. Gautier wrote the 1841 ballet story for Giselle with Jules-Henri Vernoy de Saint-Georges. ==References== Category:1811 births Category:1872 deaths Category:French poets Category:French journalists Category:French playwrights Category:French novelists Category:French literary critics Category:Librettists Category:Burials at Montmartre Cemetery, Paris Category:Writers from Occitanie Category:People from Hautes-Pyrénées Category:19th-century poets Category:19th-century novelists
title: Théophile Gautier
